column2: On a Raid

This character has taken off with a ship and crew to go reaving on foreign shores or seek out weaker merchant vessels to board and capture. Reaving is highly risky, but can also be very profitable indeed...
Black Guard

In Druchii society, few are feared quite as much as the Black Guard-- the Witch King's personal guard, answerable only to him and to Kouran, their captain. They epitomize the cold ruthlessness of the Dark Elves, trained as they are from a young age to the highest possible standards in the arts of warfare and in the use of their trademark black halberds.
Assassin

The Children of Khaine are taken by the Witch Elves from their cribs during the sacred nights, stolen from their parents. Many of this infants are killed on the Altar of Khaine, but the few who are deemed worthy are groomed to become the very hands of the God of Murder.
Malekith

Also known as "The Witch King", Malekith is the son of the great Aenarion and his second wife, Morathi. He was meant to inherit the Kingdom of Ulthuan after his father, but the princes chose Bel Shanaar instead, citing that they needed someone to rebuild rather than lead in wars. For a time Malekith accepted this, but eventually he could wait no longer, and he brought civil war and ruin to Ulthuan. Horribly scarred as the Flame of Asuryan rejected him as Phoenix King, he lives encased in a great suit of armour, always plotting to regain his birthright - the Phoenix Throne.
Druchii Mage
Under the rule of Malekith, male Druchii were not allowed to study magic. A few individuals however defied this order, but had to keep their activities well hidden.
Druchii Sorceress

Tolerating no rivals, male sorcerers are outlawed in Naggaroth by command of the Witch King. Instead, he and Morathi are served by powerful sorceresses, some who follow Atharti and others who follow Khaine.
Druchii Witch Elf

Witch Elves, also known as the brides of Khaine, devote their lives to serving the God of slaughter and give frequent devotions to him on the battlefield. They are greatly feared amongst the enemies of the Druchii.

column2: All the guests have arrived, there is a bustle of Druchii, all eager and full of festive spirit. It's time for the feast to begin!
column3: Le château est décoré de fleurs, de tentures, de tapis et de rubans de toutes les couleurs. Tous les invités sont là. Quelle belle foule de gens joyeux et remplis d'un esprit festif ! C'est l'heure, que le festin commence !
column4: Die Burg ist mit Blumen und bunten Tapeten, Teppichen und Schleifen geschmückt. Alle Gäste sind angekommen, ein wahres Gewühl von Menschen voller Freude und Festgeist. Es ist Zeit, die Feier beginnen zu lassen!
column6: El castillo está decorado con flores, coloridos tapetes, alfombras y lazos. Los invitados han llegado, hay bullicio de gente impaciente y con espíritu festivo. ¡Es hora de que comience el banquete!

column2: The feast is over, but it was a fantastic feast. As the guests make their way home you sit down and smile to yourself, pleased at how things turned out.

column4: Die Feier ist vorbei, es war ein fantastisches Fest. Als die Gäste aufbrechen, ruht Ihr Euch aus und lächelt, zufrieden mit dem Ausgang.
column6: El banquete ha terminado, pero fue fantástico. Mientras los invitados se marchan te sientas y te sonríes a ti mismo complacido de cómo han ido las cosas.

column2: I should do this again next year!

column4: Die Feier ist vorbei, doch lief es nicht ganz wie gehofft. Als die Gäste aufbrechen, ruht Ihr Euch aus und grübelt, was wohl schief ging.
column6: El banquete ha terminado, pero no ha salido como esperabas. Mientras los invitados se marchan te sientas y te preguntas qué ha salido mal.

column4: Die Feier ist vorbei, es war ein fantastisches Fest. Als Ihr nach Hause aufbrecht, hofft Ihr, nächstes Jahr wiederkommen zu dürfen.
column6: El banquete ha terminado, pero fue fantástico. Mientras regresas a casa, piensas que probablemente volverás el año que viene si te invitan.

column4: Es war eine großartige Zeit!

column3: Le festin est terminé mais des évènements malheureux vous ont empêché d'en profiter pleinement. Alors que vous rentrez chez vous, vous méditez sur les hauts et les bas de l'existence.
column4: Die Feier ist vorbei, doch einige unschöne Ereignisse verdarben die Stimmung. Als Ihr nach Hause aufbrecht, grübelt Ihr über die Höhen und Tiefen des Lebens.
column6: El banquete ha terminado, pero ciertos acontecimientos desafortunados han impedido que lo disfrutes plenamente. Mientras te diriges a casa reflexionas sobre los altibajos de la vida.

column2: A beast master is entertaining the guests at the feast. He cracks his whip and gives commands to a fearsome Manticore. The audience is held captivated by his skills as he seemingly controls the Manticore with his whip and his will.
column3: Un charmeur de serpents offre un spectacle aux invités. Il joue de la flûte et chante une étrange mélopée à l'attention des serpents venimeux qu'il a apportés dans un panier. L'audience est captivée par son talent : il semble contrôler les serpents par le son de sa voix et par sa musique.
column4: Ein Schlangenbeschwörer unterhält die Gäste auf dem Fest. Er spielt seine Flöte und singt mit seltsamen Klängen zu einigen Giftschlangen, welche er in einem Korb mitbrachte. Die Zuhörer sind ganz eingenommen von seinen Fähigkeiten, da er scheinbar die Schlangen allein mit seiner Stimme und Musik kontrolliert.
column6: Un encantador de serpientes entretiene a los invitados del banquete. Toca la flauta y canta en extraños tonos a varias serpientes venenosas que ha traído en una cesta. La audiencia está atónita con sus habilidades pues parece controlar las serpientes con su voz y con su música.

column2: Fascinating!
column3: C'est fascinant !
column4: Faszinierend.
column6: ¡Fascinante!

column2: There is a silence among the revellers as the beats master works his magic on the Manticore. But suddenly you hear a high shriek, and the beast master looks confused - it seems the towering Manticore has been enraged and is rampaging towards the guests!
column3: Les convives observent en silence le charmeur de serpents faire ses tours. Mais un cri perçant déchire l'air et le charmeur de serpents affiche une expression troublée. Il semble qu'un grand cobra ait pris quelques libertés, et le voilà qui traverse la salle en direction des invités !
column4: Die Feiernden schweigen, während der Schlangenbeschwörer seine Magie wirkt. Doch plötzlich hört Ihr einen lauten Schrei und der Beschwörer wirkt verwirrt - es scheint, dass eine große Kobra ausgebrochen ist und auf die Gäste zuschlängelt.
column6: Hay un silencio entre los asistentes cuando el encantador de serpientes realiza su magia con las serpientes. Pero de repente escuchas un alarido, el encantador de serpientes parece confuso - ¡una gran cobra está libre y rectando por el suelo hacia los invitados!

column2: Oh no!
column3: Oh non !
column4: Oh nein!
column6: ¡Oh, no!

column2: The whole feast hall is in panic as the gigantic Manticore roars, destroying furniture and killing slaves. Finally the beast opens its wings and flies off into the sky, plunging a hole in your ceiling and scaring one of your vassals half to death!
column3: Le cobra en liberté disparaît sous la table. Après quelques moments de silence, un cri perçant retentit. Le cobra s'est glissé sur les genoux d'un invité, qui manque de mourir de peur ! Le serpent disparaît ensuite rapidement par une fenêtre ouverte.
column4: Die entkommene Kobra verschwindet unter dem Tisch. Einige Momente ist alles still, dann ertönt ein lauter Schrei. Die Kobra ist in den Schoß eines Gastes gekrochen und hat ihn zu Tode erschreckt. Dann verschwindet die Schlange schnell durch ein Fenster.
column6: La cobra fugada desaparece bajo la mesa. Hay unos momentos de silencio, y después un agudo chillido. ¡La cobra se ha arrastrado hasta el regazo de uno de los invitados, dándole un susto de muerte! La serpiente desaparece por una ventana abierta.

column2: We're not hiring this beast master  again.
column3: Nous n'embaucherons plus ce charmeur de serpents.
column4: Dieser Schlangenbeschwörer wird nicht wieder auftreten!
column6: No volveremos a contratar al encantador de serpientes.

column2: The beast master is entertaining the guests at the feast with his Manticore. He cracks his whip and gives commands to the gigantic beast. Then, suddenly the beast goes out of his control and lunges towards you...
column3: Un charmeur de serpents offre un spectacle aux invités. Il joue de la flûte et chante une étrange mélopée à l'attention des serpents venimeux qu'il a apportés dans un panier. Soudain, vous sentez quelque chose de fdruchifeastd et de glissant ramper sur vos genoux...
column4: Ein Schlangenbeschwörer unterhält die Gäste auf dem Fest. Er spielt seine Flöte und singt mit seltsamen Klängen zu einigen Giftschlangen, welche er in einem Korb mitbrachte. Plötzlich fühlt Ihr etwas kaltes und schlüpfriges in Eurem Schoß
column6: Un encantador de serpientes entretiene a los invitados del banquete. Toca la flauta y canta en extraños tonos a varias serpientes venenosas que ha traído en una cesta. Entonces, de repente sientes algo frío reptando en tu regazo...

column2: Aaargh! SAVE ME!!
column3: Aaargh ! Un cobra !!
column4: Aaaaah! Eine Kobra!
column6: ¡Aaargh! ¡¡Una cobra!!

column2: The whole feast hall is in panic as the gigantic Manticore roars, destroying furniture and killing slaves, when it suddenly lunges towards one of your guests and mangles them! Finally the beast opens its wings and flies off into the sky, plunging a hole in your ceiling, its victim reduced to a red pulp.
column3: Le cobra en liberté disparaît sous la table. Quelques instants de silence, puis un cri de terreur. Un des invités est en pdruchifeaste à de violentes convulsions. Les invités le fixent, figés de peur alors qu'ils comprennent que le serpent vient de mordre l'un des leurs. Alors que le serpent disparaît par une fenêtre ouverte, la victime cesse de trembler et s'effondre, sans vie.
column4: Die entkommene Kobra verschwindet unter dem Tisch. Einige Momente ist alles still, dann ertönt ein furchtbarer Schrei. Einer der Gäste zuckt unter Krämpfen, die Gäste daneben starren schockiert, als sie merken, dass die Schlange ihren Nachbar gebissen hat. Als die Schlange durch ein offenes Fenster entkommt, liegt das Opfer ruhig da... tot!
column6: La cobra fugada desaparece bajo la mesa. Hay unos momentos de silencio, y después un chillido de terror. Uno de los invitados se estremece en violentas convulsiones, con la gente petrificada mirando en cuanto se percatan de que la cobra ha mordido al vecino. Mientras la serpiente desaparece por una ventana abierta, la víctima deja de agitarse y yace muerta.

column2: Woe!
column3: Malheur !
column4: Oh weh!
column6: ¡Lástima!

column2: The whole feast hall is in panic as the gigantic Manticore roars, destroying furniture and killing slaves. The guests are in complete disarray, except for one of them who quickly draws his sword and leaps into the creature's back, climbing to its head and driving the weapon through it.
column3: Le cobra en liberté glisse sur le sol. Les invités à la table sont comme paralysés, excepté l'un d'eux qui tire rapidement son épée et s'avance, tranchant l'animal en deux d'un coup vif.
column4: Die entkommene Schlange kriecht über den Boden. Die Gäste am Tisch wirken paralysiert, außer einer Person, welche schnell ihr Schwert zieht und mit gezieltem Schlag das Tier erschlägt.
column6: La cobra fugada se arrastra por el suelo. Los invitados de la mesa parecen paralizados, excepto una persona que rápidamente saca su espada y da un paso al frente, cortando al animal a la mitad rápidamente.

column2: Well done!
column3: Bravo !
column4: Gut gemacht!
column6: ¡Bien hecho!

column2: The beast master is entertaining the guests at the feast with his Manticore. He cracks his whip and gives commands to the gigantic beast. Then, suddenly the beast goes out of his control! You quickly draw your sword and climb up to the gigantic beast's head, driving your weapon through it.
column3: Un charmeur de serpents donne un spectacle pour les invités au festin quand soudain un cobra s'échappe ! Vous tirez rapidement votre épée et vous avancez vers la bête, que vous tranchez en deux d'un coup vif.
column4: Ein Schlangenbeschwörer unterhält die Gäste des Festes, als plötzlich eine Kobra entkommt. Schnell zieht Ihr Euer Schwert, tretet vor und hackt mit flinkem Schlag das Tier in zwei Teile.
column6: Un encantador de serpientes entretiene a los invitados del banquete, ¡hasta que la cobra escapa! Rápidamente, sacas tu espada y das un paso al frente, contando al animal a la mitad.

column2: Don't try this at home, folks.
column3: N'essayez pas ça à la maison !
column4: Macht das ja nicht zu Hause nach!
column6: No intentéis esto en casa, chicos.

column2: The Mage
column3: Le mage
column4: Der Magier
column6: El Mago

column2: There is a murmur among the guests of the feast, as a mage enters to entertain you. With great flourish, he explains that the coming show will astound even the most cyncial spectator. He proceeds to put a small boy into a basket on the floor, wherafter he swiftly chops the basket into little pieces with a sword. When he removes the shreds of the basket, there is no sign of the boy, no blood, nothing...
column3: Alors qu'un mage entre pour vous divertir, un murmure se répand dans la foule. Avec grande emphase, il explique que le spectacle qui va suivre sera à même d'étonner même le plus cynique des spectateurs. Il place ensuite un petit garçon dans un panier puis, de son épée, taillade le panier et le met en pièces. Lorsqu'il soulève ce qui reste du panier, le petit garçon a disparu, pas une goutte de sang, rien du tout...
column4: Gemurmel erhebt sich, als ein Magier hervortritt um Euch zu unterhalten. Mit großen Gesten erklärt er, dass sein Auftritt selbst den zynischsten Beobachter verblüffen wird. Daraufhin steckt er einen kleinen Jungen in einen großen, auf dem Boden stehenden Korb - und beginnt, den Korb mit einem Schwert in Stücke zu hauen. Als er die Fetzen des Korbs schließlich entfernt, ist da kein Zeichen des Jungen, kein Blut, nichts...
column6: Hay un murmullo entre los invitados al banquete, mientras un mago entra a entretenerte. Con grandes florituras, explica que la próxima actuación dejará estupefacto hasta al más cínico. Comienza a introducir a un pequeño crío en una cesta en el suelo, entonces corta el cesto en trocitos con una espada. Retira los jirones de la cesta y no hay rastro del crío, ni sangre, nada...

column2: Amazing!
column3: Épatant !
column4: Wunderbar!
column6: ¡Increíble!

column2: Guards - arrest that man!
column3: Gardes ! Arrêtez cet homme !
column4: Wachen - nehmt ihn fest!
column6: ¡Guardias, arrestad a ese hombre!

column2: There is a murmur among the guests of the feast, as a mage enters to entertain you. With great flourish, he places three cups before you on the table. He places a ball under one cup, and then tells you to observe closely and tell you where the ball is after he finishes moving the cups. He then shifts the cups around with lightning speed, all the while prattling on and telling you to pay attention. He then asks you to pick a cup.
column3: Alors qu'un mage entre pour vous divertir, un murmure se répand dans la foule. Avec grande emphase, il place tdruchifeasts coupes devant vous sur la table. Il place ensuite une balle sous l'une des coupes et vous demande de prêter la plus grande attention : vous allez devoir deviner où se trouve la balle. Il déplace ensuite les coupes à la vitesse tout en déblatérant et en vous demandant de vous concentrer. Il vous demande alors de choisir une coupe.
column4: Gemurmel erhebt sich, als ein Magier hervortritt, um Euch zu unterhalten. Mit großen Gesten stellt er drei Becher auf den Tisch vor Euch. Er platziert eine kleine Kugel unter einem davon und fordert Euch auf, gut zu beobachten und ihm zu verraten, wo die Kugel nach dem Bewegen der Becher ist. Dann verschiebt er die Becher blitzartig hin und her, während er weiter plappert und aufzupassen ermahnt. Schließlich sollt Ihr einen Becher wählen.
column6: Hay un murmullo entre los invitados al banquete, mientras un mago entra a entretenerte. Con grandes florituras, coloca tres copas en la mesa. Coloca una bola bajo una copa, y te dice que observes detenidamente y digas dónde está la bola cuando termine de mover las copas. Entonces mueve las copas a la velocidad del rayo, todo mientras parlotea y te dice que prestes atención. Entonces te pide que elijas una copa.

column2: Left.
column3: Celle de gauche.
column4: Links.
column6: Izquierda.

column2: Middle.
column3: Celle du milieu.
column4: Mitte.
column6: Centro.

column2: Right.
column3: Celle de ddruchifeastte.
column4: Rechts.
column6: Derecha.

column2: The magician looks at you with a knowing and superior smile as he reveals the ball. It seems you chose the wrong cup.
column3: Le magicien vous toise de son air supérieur et dévoile l'emplacement de la balle. Visiblement, vous n'avez pas choisi la bonne coupe.
column4: Der Magier schaut Euch mit wissendem Lächeln an und enthüllt die Kugel. Scheinbar habt Ihr den falschen Becher gewählt.
column6: El mago te mira con una sonrisa de superioridad y revela la bola. Parece que elegiste la que no era.

column2: Oh snap.
column3: Zut !
column4: Oh verdammt.
column6: Lo tengo.

column2: I think you are cheating!
column3: Je pense que vous avez triché !
column4: Ich glaube, Ihr betrügt!
column6: ¡Creo que haces trampas!

column2: I saw you cheating, you trickster!
column3: Je vous ai vu tricher, sale escroc !
column4: Ich sah Euch mogeln, Ihr Gauner!
column6: ¡Te he visto hacer trampas, embaucador!

column2: There is a murmur among the guests of the feast, as a mage enters to entertain you. With great flourish, he explains that you are about to see something amazing. He takes out a rope and starts playing a flute. The rope starts dancing by itself and rises up towards the ceiling. The magician beckons, and a small boy appears and starts climbing the rope. The audience gasps. After a minute, the boy climbs down, the magician stops playing and the rope falls down again.
column3: Alors qu'un mage entre pour vous divertir, un murmure se répand dans la foule. Avec grande emphase, il vous explique que vous allez être le témoin d'une chose extraordinaire. Il sort une corde et commence à jouer de la flûte. La corde se met à danser toute seule et monte ainsi jusqu'au plafond. Le magicien fait un signe de la tête. Un petit garçon s'avance et commence à monter le long de la corde. Les spectateurs retiennent leur souffle. Après une minute, l'enfant redescend. Le magicien arrête de jouer et la corde tombe au sol.
column4: Gemurmel erhebt sich, als ein Magier hervortritt, um Euch zu unterhalten. Mit großen Gesten erklärt er, dass Ihr gleich etwas Wunderbares sehen werdet. Er holt ein Seil hervor und beginnt auf der Flöte zu spielen. Das Seil beginnt zu tanzen und erhebt sich zur Decke. Der Magier klascht, ein kleiner Junge erscheint und erklettert das Seil. Das Publikum keucht. Nach einer Minute steigt der Junge wieder herab, der Magier beendet sein Flötenspiel und das Seil fällt wieder herab.
column6: Hay un murmullo entre los invitados al banquete, mientras un mago entra a entretenerte. Con grandes florituras, explica que vais a ver algo increíble. Coge una cuerda y comienza a tocar una flauta. La cuerda comienza a danzar hacia el techo. El mago hace un gesto y un pequeño chico aparece y comienza a trepar por la cuerda. El público contiene un grito. Tras un minuto, el chico desciende de la cuerda, el mago deja de tocar la flauta y la cuerda cae.

column2: Hah! I could see the hidden wire.
column3: Joli ! Vous aviez un fil invisible, je l'ai vu !
column4: Hah! Ich konnte den versteckten Draht sehen.
column6: ¡Ja! He podido ver un cable oculto.

column2: You are sitting at the table during the feast, enjoying the food and drink. Suddenly, you hear a wild chattering and screaming. A group of small monkeys have entered through an open window, and they quickly spread in the hall, causing chaos! They pull people's hair and clothes, steal food, spill wine, drink wine and defecate on the tables. The feast hall is in uproar.
column3: Vous voilà à table pendant le festin, à savourer votre repas et votre verre. Soudain, vous entendez une discussion animée entrecoupée de cris. Un groupe de petits singes est entré par une fenêtre ouverte et se répand dans la salle, entraînant le chaos ! Ils tirent les gens par les cheveux et les vêtements, volent de la nourriture, renversent les coupes, boivent le vin et défèquent sur les tables. La salle du festin est en émoi.
column4: Ihr sitzt am Tisch und genießt das Fest, vor allem Speis und Trank. Plötzlich hört Ihr lautes Geschwätz und Schreie. Eine Gruppe kleiner Affen ist durch ein offenes Fenster eingedrungen, verteilt sich in der Halle und verursacht Chaos! Sie ziehen an Haaren und Kleidern, stehlen Essen, verschütten und trinken Wein oder entleeren ihren Darm auf den Tischen. Die Festhalle ist in Aufruhr!
column6: Te sientas en una mesa durante el banquete, disfrutando de la comida y la bebida. De repente, escuchas un parloteo salvaje y gritos. Un pequeño grupo de monos ha entrado por una ventana abierta, y rápidamente se distribuyen por el salón, ¡causando el caos! Tiran a la gente del pelo y las ropas, roban la comida, tiran el vino o se lo beben y defecan en las mesas. El salón de banquetes es un clamor.

column2: Oh my!
column3: Grands dieux !
column4: Oh mein
column6: ¡Oh, madre!

column2: Hand me my bow!
column3: Passez-moi mon arc !
column4: Reicht mir meinen Bogen!
column6: ¡Acercadme mi arco!

column2: Let's catch one and see what they look like on the inside...
column3: Attrapons-en un et voyons de quoi ça a l'air à l'intérieur...
column4: Lasst uns einen fangen und schauen, wie er innen aussieht
column6: Cojamos a uno y veamos cómo es por dentro...

column2: The monkeys are my friends!
column3: Les singes sont mes amis !
column4: Die Affen sind meine Freunde!
column6: ¡Los monos son mis amigos!

column2: Such beautiful animals! I shall marry one of them!
column3: Ces animaux sont si beaux ! Je vais en épouser un !
column4: Solch wunderbare Tiere. Ich sollte einen heiraten!
column6: ¡Unos animales tan bonitos! ¡Debería casarme con uno!

column2: Haha! Look at the little rascals! So carefree!
column3: Haha ! Regardez-moi ces petits garnements ! Ils sont si insouciants !
column4: Haha. Schaut Euch die Kleinen an. So sorglos!
column6: ¡Ja, ja! ¡Mira a esos pequeños pillos! ¡Tan despreocupados!

column2: Aaah! Get those little monsters out of here!
column3: Aaah ! Faites sortir ces petits monstres !
column4: Aaaah! Schafft die kleinen Monster weg!
column6: ¡Aaah! ¡Sacad a esos pequeños monstruos de aquí!

column2: The darkest night of the Diwali is here, the most important night of the feast. Candles and lamps are lit everywhere, the guests stroll across the painted and decorated floor, wearing colorful dress. Rich and sweet food is served, and the drink is also plentiful. Rama and Lakshi are honored, celebrating the victory of light over darkness, good over evil and hope over despair.
column3: La nuit la plus sombre du Diwali est là. C'est la nuit la plus importante du festin. On allume des chandelles et des lampes partout. Les invités marchent sur le sol décoré de peintures, portant des habits colorés. On sert de la nourriture riche et sucrée, et du vin en abondance. On honore Rama et Lakshi, et on célèbre le triomphe de la lumière sur les ténèbres, du bien sur le mal et de l'espoir sur le désespoir.
column4: Die dunkelste Nacht von Diwali ist da, die wichtigste Nacht des Festes. Kerzen und Lampen werden überall entzündet, die Gäste schlendern in bunten Kostümen durch das bemalte und geschmückte Anwesen. Vielfältige, süße Speisen werden gebracht und die Getränke sind ebenso reichlich. Rama und Lakshi werden geehrt, gefeiert wird der Sieg von Licht über Dunkelheit, Gut über Böse und Hoffnung über Verzweiflung.
column6: La noche más oscura del Diwali ha llegado, la noche más importante del banquete. Hay velas y lámparas encendidas por doquier, los invitados, en llamativos vestidos, pasean por el suelo decorado. Se sirve comida rica y dulce, y abunda la bebida. Rama y Lakshmi son honrados, celebrando el triunfo de la luz sobre la oscuridad, del bien sobre el mal y de la esperanza sobre la desesperación.

column2: Let us celebrate!
column3: Célébrons !
column4: Lasst uns feiern!
column6: ¡Celebrémoslo!

You celebrate the victory of light over darkness, good over evil, knowledge over ignorance and hope over despair.

column2: The darkest night of the Diwali is here, the most important night of the feast. Candles and lamps are lit everywhere, the guests stroll across the painted and decorated floor, wearing colorful dress. Rich and sweet food is served. The attainment of Nirvana of Lord Mahavira, the last Tirthankar, is celebrated, with the victory of good over evil and knowledge over ignorance.
column3: La nuit la plus sombre de Diwali commence. C'est la nuit la plus importante du festin. On allume des chandelles et des lampes partout. Les invités marchent sur le sol décoré de peintures, portant des habits colorés. On sert de la nourriture riche et sucrée. On célèbre l'accession du seigneur Mahavira, le dernier Tirthankar, au Nirvana, ainsi que la victoire du bien sur le mal et de la connaissance sur l'ignorance.
column4: Die dunkelste Nacht von Diwali ist da, die wichtigste Nacht des Festes. Kerzen und Lampen werden überall entzündet, die Gäste schlendern in bunten Kostümen durch das bemalte und geschmückte Anwesen. Vielfältige, süße Speisen werden gereicht und die Getränke sind ebenso reichlich. Der Aufstieg Lord Mahaviras, dem letzten Tirthankar, wird gefeiert und der Sieg von Gut über Böse und Wissen über Unwissen.
column6: La noche más oscura del Diwali ha llegado, la noche más importante del banquete. Hay velas y lámparas encendidas por doquier, los invitados, en llamativos vestidos, pasean por el suelo decorado. Se sirve comida dulce y deliciosa. La consecución del Nirvana del Vardhamana Mahavirá, el último Tirthankara, se celebra, con la victoria del bien sobre el mal y de la sabiduría sobre la ignorancia.

column2: Let us celebrate!
column3: Célébrons !
column4: Lasst uns feiern!
column6: ¡Celebrémoslo!

column2: The feast of Khaine is here, a most important event. The guests stroll across the decorated floor- Homage is offered to the fearsome statues with wicked swords, dripping blood from their hands.
column3: La nuit la plus sombre du Kali Puja commence. C'est la nuit la plus importante du festin. On allume des chandelles partout, placées dans des crânes humains. Les invités marchent sur le sol décoré de peintures, portant avec eux divers symboles du temps, de la mort et du changement. On rend hommage aux belles et terrifiantes idoles à quatre bras tenant dans leurs mains des épées, des crânes et des têtes tranchées.
column4: Die dunkelste Nacht von Kali Puja ist da, die wichtigste Nacht des Festes. Kerzen werden überall entzündet und in menschliche Schädel gesteckt. Die Gäste schlendern durch das bemalte und geschmückte Anwesen und tragen verschiedene Symbolen der Zeit, des Todes und der Veränderung. Geehrt werden die wunderschönen und schrecklichen vierarmigen Bildnisse mit Schwertern, Schädeln und abgetrennten Köpfen in ihren Händen.
column6: La noche más oscura del Kali Puja ha llegado, la noche más importante del banquete. Hay velas encendidas por doquier, dentro de calaveras humanas. Los invitados pasean por el suelo pintado y decorado, llevando símbolos variados del tiempo, la muerte y el cambio. Se honra a los hermosos y terroríficos ídolos de cuatro brazos, armados con espadas, calaveras y cabezas cortadas en sus manos.

column2: Let the ceremonies begin.
column3: Que la cérémonie commence.
column4: Lasst die Zeremonie beginnen.
column6: Que comiencen las ceremonias.

column2: Now...for the sacrifices!
column3: Cette année, voyons les choses en grand.
column4: Dieses Jahr etwas Besonderes
column6: Hagamos algo más este año...

column2: Khaela Mensha Khaine, The Bloody Handed and Lord of Murder must be honored properly, with a great and bloody sacrifice...
column3: Kali est notre Mère, la déesse du temps, de la mort et de la sombre nuit. Il faut l'honorer comme il se doit, et vous avez trouvé l'idée parfaite pour cela...
column4: Kali ist unsere Mutter, Göttin der Zeit, des Todes und der Dunkelsten Nacht. Sie muss besonders geehrt werden und Ihr habt genau das Richtige im Sinn
column6: Kali es nuestra madre, la Diosa del Tiempo, la Muerte y la noche Oscura. Debe ser honrada adecuadamente, y tú tienes lo apropiado en la cabeza...

column2: We will sacrifice a prisoner...
column3: Nous allons sacrifier un prisonnier...
column4: Wir werden einen Gefangenen opfern
column6: Sacrificaremos a un prisionero...

column2: We will sacrifice our finest slave specimens.
column3: Nous allons sacrifier ce serviteur, lui, juste là.
column4: Wir werden diesen Diener da opfern.
column6: Sacrificaremos a aquel sirviente de allí.

column2: We will sacrifice a manticore and paint the walls its blood!
column3: Nous allons sacrifier dix éléphants et repeindre les murs de leur sang.
column4: Wir werden zehn Elefanten opfern und die Wände mit Blut streichen.
column6: Sacrificaremos a diez elefantes y pintaremos las paredes con sangre.

column2: [From.GetFullName] screams as [From.GetSheHe] is dragged before the great stayte of Khaine. As witch elves hold [From.GetHerHim] down, one of them pulls out a long knife and then stabs [From.GetHerHim] right through the heart. Then [From.GetHerHis] throat is cut and the blood is slowly collected in a giant cauldron beneath the staute of the Lord of Murder.
column3: [From.GetFullName] hurle alors qu'on le traîne devant la grande idole de Kali. Les serviteurs du temple l'immobilisent et un prêtre sort un long kris dont il se sert pour lui transpercer le cur. Ensuite, il lui tranche la gorge et son sang est lentement recueilli dans des coupes taillées dans des crânes humains que l'on passe ensuite aux invités afin qu'ils y boivent.
column4: [From.GetFullName] schreit, als er vor die großen Bildnisse von Kali gezerrt wird. Tempeldiener halten ihn fest, ein Priester zieht ein langes Kris und sticht ihm mitten ins Herz. Dann wird seine Kehle aufgeschnitten, sein Blut in Schüsseln aus menschlichen Schädeln gesammelt und unter den Gästen zum Trinken verteilt.
column6: [From.GetFullName] grita mientras es arrastrado ante el gran ídolo de Kali. Mientras los sirvientes del templo lo postran, un sacerdote saca un largo kris y lo clava atravesando su corazón. Luego corta su garganta y la sangre es recogida lentamente en cuencos hechos con calaveras humanas que se pasan a los invitados para que beban.

column2: This is truly a joyous occasion!
column3: Voilà bien une occasion de grande réjouissances !
column4: Welch freudiger Anlass!
column6: ¡Es una ocasión jubilosa!

column2: The slaves scream as they are is herded in by the guards and then dragged before the great statue of Khaine. Witch elves hold them down and cut their throats one by one, collecting their blood in a great cauldron beneath the statue of the Lord of Murder.
column3: Le serviteur hurle lorsque les gardes s'en saisissent et le traînent devant la grande idole de Kali. Les serviteurs du temple l'immobilisent et un prêtre sort un long kris dont il se sert pour lui transpercer le cur. Ensuite, il lui tranche la gorge et son sang est lentement recueilli dans des coupes taillées dans des crânes humains que l'on passe ensuite aux invités afin qu'ils y boivent.
column4: Der Diener schreit, als er vor die großen Bildnisse von Kali gezerrt wird. Tempeldiener halten ihn fest, ein Priester zieht ein langes Kris und sticht ihm mitten ins Herz. Dann wird seine Kehle aufgeschnitten, sein Blut in Schüsseln aus menschlichen Schädeln gesammelt und unter den Gästen zum Trinken verteilt.
column6: El sirviente grita mientras es apresado por los guardias y arrastrado ante el gran ídolo de Kali. Mientras los sirvientes del templo lo postran, un sacerdote saca un largo kris y lo clava atravesando su corazón. Luego corta su garganta y la sangre es recogida lentamente en cuencos hechos con calaveras humanas que se pasan a los invitados para que beban.

column2: A celebration in blood
column3: Une célébration dans le sang
column4: Eine Feier in Blut!
column6: Una celebración de sangre.

column2: A large manticore is led into the hall. It is tied down with strong ropes and chains, and then stabbed with swords, screaming and roaring terribly for several minutes as it dies. The guests watch in glee. The process is then repeated with nine more times - a long, bloody cacophonic concert of death. At the end of it, the floor is a lake of blood. Several witch elves step forth, sliding and slipping in the gore, holding long brushes. They dip the brushes in the blood and start painting the walls, eventually covering them entirely in this gruesome, wet and dark paint. The smell is powerful.
column3: On fait entrer un grand éléphant dans la salle. On l'immobilise au moyen de grosses cordes et de lourdes chaînes, puis on le transperce avec des épées. Il hurle et barrit atrocement pendant plusieurs minutes alors qu'il agonise. Les invités regardent le spectacle avec une fascination mêlée d'horreur. On effectue ensuite la même chose avec neuf autres éléphants : un long et sanglant concert cacophonique de mort. La cérémonie terminée, le sol n'est plus qu'un lac de sang. Plusieurs prêtres s'avancent, glissant dans le sang qui coagule, de longs balais en main. Ils trempent les balais dans le sang et commencent à en peindre les murs, qui se retrouvent au bout d'un moment couverts de cette horrible peinture humide et sombre. L'odeur est puissante et donne la nausée.
column4: Ein großer Elefant wird in die Halle geführt. Er wird mit schweren Seilen und Ketten gefesselt, dann mit Schwertern niedergestochen. Sterbend schreit und trompetet er minutenlang. Die Gäste schauen mit schrecklicher Faszination zu. Dann wird der Prozess mit neun anderen Elefanten wiederholt - ein langes, kakofonisches Konzert des Todes. Am Ende ist der Boden ein See aus Blut. Priester treten vor, rutschend im gerinnenden Blut, mit langen Besen in den Händen. Sie tränken die Besen im Blut und beginnen, die Wände mit der dunklen, feuchten, grauenhaften Farbe zu bedecken. Der Geruch ist stark und widerlich.
column6: Un gran elefante es conducido al salón. Lo atan con fuertes cuerdas y cadenas y lo apuñalan con espadas, gritando y barritando terriblemente durante minutos hasta que muere. Los invitados miran con horrorizada fascinación. El proceso se repite con otros nueve elefantes - una larga y sangrienta cacofonía para un concierto mortal. Al finalizar, el suelo es un lago de sangre. Algunos sacerdotes avanzan, resbalando por los restos, llevando largas escobas. Mojan las escobas en la sangre y comienzan a pintar los muros, cubriéndolos completamente con la espantosa pintura. El olor es fuerte y repugnante.

column2: Praise Khaine, Lord of Murder!
column3: Gloire à notre mère Kali !
column4: Ehret Kali, unsere Mutter!
column6: ¡Rezad a Kali, nuestra Madre!

column2: Several cold ones are brought forth by the priests. The cold ones are laid down below a large statue of Khaine, and their throats are cut open. The blood is collected in bowls made of skulls of a thousand slaves and presented to the crowd. A chanting arises, then a cheer, as the sacred sacrifice to the Lord of Murder has been made.
column3: Les prêtres font venir plusieurs chèvres noires. Les chèvres sont couchées au pied d'une grande statue de Kali et on leur tranche la gorge. On recueille ensuite le sang dans des coupes taillées dans des crânes humains que l'on passe ensuite à l'assistance. Une psalmodie s'élève, puis des acclamations : le sacrifice à la déesse de la mort, du temps et de la plus noire des nuit est accompli.
column4: Mehrere schwarze Ziegen werden von Priestern herbeigebracht. Die Ziegen werden vor die große Statue Kalis gelegt und ihre Kehlen aufgeschnitten. Das Bluten wird in aus Menschenschädeln gemachten Schüsseln aufgefangen und der Menge präsentiert. Gesänge erheben sich, während das heilige Opfer für Kali, Göttin des Todes, der Zeit und der Schwärzesten Nacht, gebracht wird.
column6: Los sacerdotes traen varias cabras negras. Tumban las cabras bajo una gran estatua de Kali, y abren sus gargantas. La sangre se recoge en cuencos hechos con calaveras humanas y es ofrecida a la muchedumbre. Un canto se alza, luego vítores, mientras el sagrado sacrificio a la Diosa de la Muerte, el Tiempo y la Noche más Oscura es realizado.

column2: Praise Khaine, Lord of Murder!
column3: Gloire à notre mère Kali !
column4: Preiset Kali, unsere Mutter!
column6: ¡Rezad a Kali, nuestra Madre!

column2: Certainly. That sounds entertaining!
No, I won't waste money on such things.

A band of wandering pit fighters asks if you'd like to hire them for your feast. They offer to put on a bloody demonstration for the evening, going up against any challengers - beasts or slaves - that you can find.
No, that's not bloody enough for me.
A group of sword dancers arrive, asking for your patronage. They will entertain your guests with their dazzling displays of skill and will fight in a mock battle for your amusement.
Send swift riders immediately.
It is time to send out the invitations to your vassals for the feast.
Your liege invites you to a great feast. Will you attend?
Insolent cur! It was not a request...
Dread Liege, unfortunately I am not able to come to your feast. Matters of greater importance require that I stay home and attend to these affairs.
Your guests finally arrive with their heavily armed retinues, and they renew their vows of fealty and obedience as they kneel before your throne. Now for the entertainment!

Your liege welcomes you, and you renew your vows of fealty and obedience before the dread throne. Hopefully the entertainment and food will be good this year, and you will have your fill of both wine and blood!
Actually, this wine is one degree too warm!
The food is spectacular... slow roasted human hearts, exquisite wine from Tilean orchards, and a lavish display of all other food types plundered from around the known world. Delicious!
One of your vassals loudly praises the bounty of your table and the fineness of your drinks.
Of course - dark singers are always welcome here.
Of course - dark singers are always welcome here.
A travelling dark singer of Khaine offers to bless your feast with songs of bloody murder and war. Do you wish to hire her?
You overhear one of your vassals complaining about the food to those around him. Why, the gall, the insolence!
You have set a fine table, dread liege!
I eat better at home than this!
You have set a fine table, dread liege!
The food is all right, and there is plenty of it and more than enough wine. While not the best feast table ever, there is not much to complain about.
*lie* Thank you for this feast, dread liege!
Dammit, I can't eat this slave food!
*lie* Thank you for this feast, dread liege!
The food is - to put it mildly - not that impressive. Fish, bread, ale, cheap wine... but perhaps it's best not to comment on it.
I have made a new ally tonight!
Late at night, you speak to one of your guests and find that this is an amazing individual. You talk late into the night, plotting together and coming up with ways to achieve both your goals...
I have made a new ally tonight!
You end up spending half the night talking to this person, and find that you have much in common and can help each other in achieving common goals.
No, this will just be a simple gathering!
A beastmaster and his retinue arrive, offering to entertain your guests with glorious slaughter as his beasts are pitted against slaves, courtiers you dislike, or other beasts.
The pit fighters you hire put on a spectacular show, defeating both slaves and beasts put against them, and blood flows for the glory of Khaine!
The pit fighters your liege hired for the feast put on a spectacular show - never have you seen such skill in the pits, they cut through both slaves and beasts like true professionals!

The Dark Singer begins her song, and the halls are filled with glorious lyrics extolling the bloody slaughter of Khaine. Your cold heart almost begins to warm as the music makes you think of endless slaughter and eternal glory...
The Dark Singer your host has hired begins her song, and the halls are filled with glorious lyrics extolling the bloody slaughter of Khaine. It stirs our dark soul, the haunting beauty of her song...
The beastmaster you hired puts on an excellent show - monstrous beasts of all sorts fight for your amusement and several novel killing techniques are demonstrated!
The beastmaster your host has hired puts on an excellent show - monstrous beasts of all sorts fight for your amusement and several novel killing techniques are demonstrated!
I only wish there were 1000 of them!
Finally the Asur prisoners you bought are presented to your guests. To great cheering, they are cruelly tortured and executed. Glory to Naggaroth!
Spectacular display of torture!
Finally the Asur prisoners your host has bought are presented to your guests. To great cheering, they are cruelly tortured and executed. Glory to Naggaroth!
To roaring laughs, a group of halfling jugglers are brought out. Large stones are passed out to the guests - the last halfling to remain juggling wins his life, the rest will be cruelly tortured!
Human hearts, and only the finest wines!
Regular fare will suffice - venison, cheese, and wine.
Fish, bread, and ale will suffice!
It's time to decide what you will serve your guests at the feast.
I haven't laughed so hard in ages!

To roaring laughs, a group of halfling slave jugglers your liege has purchased are brought out. Large stones are passed out to the guests - the last halfling to remain juggling wins his life, the rest will be cruelly tortured!
One of your guests comment loudly on how stunningly the sword dancer display was. Good, then they were well worth the money!
A band of outlaws is troubling your demesne, these should be cleared out so your highborn guests are assured safe travels to your feast.
A slave trader offers to sell you some prisoners from Ulthuan so that they can be sacrificed before the feast and grant Khaine's blessing to your endeavours.
Hah! I have to have this at my feast...
Funny, but no - we'll have to make do without them.
A slave trader offers to send you a group of halfling juggler slaves
column3: it will be most amusing he assures you. They juggle while stones are thrown at them, and only the last halfling to remain juggling is spared from ritual execution.

column2: I could have done just as well.

While on a border patrol, a servant won a great victory against a pack of marauding fiends. [From.GetSheHeCap] cut into their ranks, and put dozens of them to the sword. [From.GetSheHeCap] is truly blessed by the gods!
Imprison [From.GetHerHim]! I'll torture [From.GetHerHim] myself later...

While on a border patrol, a servant's warband was ambushed, but [From.GetSheHe] fled and left [From.GetHerHis] men to die! [From.GetSheHeCap] name is in disgrace, and [From.GetSheHe] has surely angered the gods with [From.GetHerHis] cowardice.
Yes, time to go home and put this wealth to good use.
Yes, time to go home and put this wealth to good use.
You have raided for a long time now and amassed great wealth. Perhaps it is time to stop, before your luck runs out?
Inform the crew - we bathe in blood tonight!
Inform the crew - we bathe in blood tonight!
Off the coast of the Old World one night you spot lights ahead
column3: it seems to be a small village. Do you want to go in and and pillage it?

column2: You silently sail up to the village, and then stealthily slip your warriors around it before unleashing a great war cry - the slaughter is glorious, and you take many slaves as captives!

You get your warband ashore, but as soon as you approach the village an alarm goes off, and worse still the militia are reinforced by a contingent of patrolling knights! Curses - this village is too heavily defended!
You come across a merchant convoy of human ships. There are three of them, but it looks like they are not warships. Prepare to board them?
Corsairs - full sail! Prepare for boarding action!
No, attacking three ships is too risky.
Bolt throwers, prepare to cut down their masts!
Damnation. Three on one, hardly favourable. Time to withdraw.
Spotting your sail, the ships turn towards you - brave fools, are they are actually going to try and fight you?
And they had a rich cargo too!

Your bolt throwers expertly disable the sails of two of the ships, leaving them dead in the water. Your crew board the other ship, and one by one, the others fall to. The sailors are cut down when they resist, with a choice selection of slaves picked from the 'lucky' survivors. This is a great victory!
Turn about, we'll outsail these scows!
Your bolt throwers failed to disable the approaching ships, and one of them carries a catapult which sends its own missiles your way. If one of them hits, it could be the end of you...
Prepare to repel boarders - bolt throwers, fire at will!
Curses! An Eagle Ship from Ulthuan has spotted your sail, and is fast approaching. You can't outrun the warship sent by your vile cousins, you'll have to try to repel their attack...
Your liege's court is crowded, and it's time to thin the herd. By getting rid of your competitors, your own favour in the eyes of your liege can only increase...
We claim their ship, it will fetch a good price.

Your cousins catch up to you but you managed to disable their bolt thrower with your own counter-strikes. A fierce boarding action ensues, but the hatred and ferocity of your crew overcomes the attempt, and soon the high elves are all dead, or fated for much worse...

A deadly shooting match ensues, you manage to do serious damage to their sails, but your own ship has been battered as well. It's time to attempt one last shot at their main mast, otherwise it looks like you won't be able to flee...
You have become wounded, and can no longer carry on the raiding life. It is time to return to your home and regain your strength.
Though temporarily defeated, you will never give up your claims to your ancestral homeland.
While working on one of your schemes, a rival at court has emerged. You will have to work towards destroying this individual before you yourself are destroyed!
Do not bother me with this again.
Court rumours say that one of your courtiers has gained a rival at court
column3: it should be interesting to see how this plays out in the future as they work towards foiling each other's schemes.

column2: A most excellent deal. Throw [From.GetHerHim] in the cells!
A most excellent deal. Throw [From.GetHerHim] in the cells!
A group of corsairs have captured a noble, and offer to sell him to you for a small fee. He is surely worth more than that in ransom... or else he would make a worthy sacrifice to Khaine?
W-wait... am I in... Naggaroth?
I'll get out... and when I do...
You pass out, and after days or weeks of fever dreams lying wounded on a ship somewhere, you wake up in a dark dungeon. Gods, where is this place, and why is it so dark and cold?
500 gold? Sounds like a bargain... Dwarf slaves live for at least 20 years.
500 gold? Sounds like a bargain... Dwarf slaves live for at least 20 years.
Do not bother me with this again.
Certainly, I shall return with slaves and plunder!
Certainly, I shall return with slaves and plunder!
You are a noble of Naggaroth, and you can outfit an expedition to go raiding abroad for the glory of Khaine and the Witch King. Do you wish to start looking for a ship and crew?
Curses! But hate will carry me on...

You have become maimed, and can no longer carry on the raiding life. It is time to return to your home, and let others lead from the front lines while you carefully manage your wealth and power from your court.

News have reached you [From.GetTitledFirstName] has started preparing a great invasion to reclaim Ulthuan. The wretched armies of corrupt Druchii raiders and witches gather already under [From.GetHerHis] banner.

News have reached you [From.GetTitledFirstName] has started preparing a great invasion to reclaim Ulthuan. The wretched armies of feeble Asur warriors and mages gather already under [From.GetHerHis] banner.
We must prepare.
We must prepare.

You've stalled for too long. Slowly, the forces you've gathered for your great invasion have lost their interest and fallen into petty squabbles for power, leaving you with no united force to wrestle Ulthuan from the wretched Asur.

You've stalled for too long. Slowly, the forces you've gathered for your great campaign of reconquest have lost their interest, thorn by debates regarding the validity of attacking now and leaving you with no united force to wrestle Ulthuan from the wretched Druchii.
Incompetent fools!
It'll be for another time...
A great host of raiders has gathered under your banner, they wait anxiously to set sail for Ulthuan.
A great host of warriors has gathered under your banner,they wait anxiously to set sail for Ulthuan.
Good.
A famous raider has come to your court, offering his allegiance and willingness to help you reclaim Ulthuan for a small share of the spoils.
A famous commander has come to your court, offering his allegiance and willingness to help you reclaim Ulthuan and deliver it from its corruption.
Good.
A small host of raiders has gathered under your banner, they wait anxiously to set sail for Ulthuan.
A small host of warriors has gathered under your banner, they wait anxiously to set sail for Ulthuan.
Good.
Your prisoner is thrown in the public pit and the cold one is released soon after. The creature growls and hisses at the victim for a while and then leaps forward, ripping them apart.
Who's hungry?
Your jailer has decided to punish you by tossing you in their pit and have a cold one devour you.
Aaah!!
Your prisoner is tied in the middle of the square, for all to see. At your call, the dragon comes down from above, burning them to a crisp and feasting on the remains.
Who's hungry?
Your jailer has decided to punish you by tossing you in their pit and have their dragon devour you.
Aaah!!

Your prisoner is tied in the middle of the square, for all to see. At your call, the griffon comes down from above, wrapping his claws around the body of the victim and starting to peel off skin with his beak, feasting while the prisoner is still alive and screaming.
Who's hungry?
Your jailer has decided to punish you by tossing you in their pit and have their Griffon devour you.
Aaah!!

And so it has come to pass that not a man but a woman trained in the arcane arts defeated the Witch King. For centuries Malekith forbade men from practising magic under his lands, needlessly fearing for a prophecy which is clear now he so greatly misunderstood. This is a great day for the Asur, as their greatest enemy has been defeated and the remaining Druchii will soon fight amongst themselves for his legacy.

And so it has come to pass that a mage defeated the Witch King, just as Caledor prophesied. For centuries Malekith forbade men from practising magic under his lands, but in the end there was nothing he could do to avoid his destiny. This is a great day for the Asur, as their greatest enemy has been defeated and the remaining Druchii will soon fight amongst themselves for his legacy.

And so it has come to pass that a commoner defeated the Witch King. For centuries Malekith forbade men from practising magic under his lands, fearing the a mage would have been born and trained in the arcane art, become more powerful than him and destroy him, like Caledor prophesied. Yet, in the end, it was through mundane means that the Witch King of Naggaroth found his end. This is a great day for the Asur, as their greatest enemy has been defeated and the remaining Druchii will soon fight amongst themselves for his legacy.
A great accomplishment.
The Witch King dies...

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has grown weary of the squabbling of [From.GetHerHis] subjects. Unleashing [From.GetHerHis] host of spies and informants, [From.GetSheHe] is surveying Naggaroth to cut down any attempt at insurrection. You, as well as your supporters, have decided it might be best to dissolve your factions for now.
Our time will come again.
You've discovered another amongst your servants, [From.GetTitledFirstName], who thought he could secretely practice the dark arts to grow more powerful than you and kill you.
There is no doubt about it: your [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] shows the gift of a sorcerer-to-be. Why else would he have hid this from you if not to plot against your throne?
I shall not die by your sorcery!
The prophecy must not be fulfilled. Not even by you, my son.

The Witch-King discovered of your meddling with the dark arts and has quickly sent his best assassins to deal with you. Before you can even react, the shadowy druchii sink their blades in your back time and again.
Hhhggghhh...
All able-bodied young Naggarothi are expected to serve the Witch King in the Black Guard army for a hundred-years draft.
I will ask permission to my liege.

All able-bodied young Naggarothi are expected to serve the Witch King in the Black Guard army for a hundred-years draft. [From.GetFirstName] has reached the proper age, the officers from Naggarond will soon come to take [From.GetHerHim].
Very well.
I can convince them to do otherwise
[From.GetFirstName] has not opposed the Witch King's edict. It is time for you to depart and join the Black Guard.
[From.GetFirstName] has used bribes and threats against the Naggarondi officiers to prevent you from leaving court. It seems you shall avoid the draft entirely.
I see

Your draft has finally come to an end. In this years you've come to trust and rely on the men of your regiment, will you abandon them to resume your duties as a Naggarothi nobleman or will you stay in the Black Guard forever?
I will stay.
Enough of this.
Your [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] has decided that he will never return, taking his place as a Black Guard permanently in the army of the Witch King.
So be it.
The training in the army is no less cutthroat than the rest of druchii society. Sadly it appears you did not have what it takes to be a Black Guard.
No!
Your [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] has felt the call of Khaine and decided to become a Witch Elf. As Khaine is a jealous god, she won't be able to marry anyone else.
Very well.
I won't allow this.

You have devoted yourself to the Lord of Murder, giving away your possessions and proclaiming yourself to be his bride. In these following years you shall train and learn the rites and secrets of the Witches, so that you may better serve your master.
For Khaine!

Years have passed, but, despite your fervor, you were judged lacking in the eyes of the Lord of Murder. A Khainite Assassin has been sent to dispose of you and, as the lights go out, you are made aware in a cold whisper that you have failed your god.
Hghhh

For years you have trained and bathed in the blood of your enemies, offering their beating hearts at the altar of Khaine. The Lord of Murder looks favourably upon you and the other Witch Elves have come to see you as a respected member of their coven.
As they should.
No mercy and no love. The Lord of Murder beckons death and suffering and in the rivers of blood shed in his honor, you cannot feel anything but excitement and anticipation.
Their screams are like music.
The horrors and peril in the church of Khaine have ironed your soul and sharpened your senses. You no longer feel fear.
Only you should be afraid.
The constant strain of the savage rituals and the blood-soaked campaigns have made you stronger and faster than the ordinary elf. Few can hold their own against you in a duel.
Their blood for my strength!
Khaine rules over death, none can escape his grasp, neither the greatest warrior nor the wisest sorcerer, all pay tribute to the Lord of Murder in the end.
For Khaine!
Working with blades and daggers day and night can certainly leave the mark.
Each scar brings glory to Khaine.

All Witches are Khaine's brides. He is a jealous god and does not tolerate any man to touch them. Yet, you've found there's another kind of solace to be found in his halls, warmer and softer than what the god's statue can provide
Hmm
Through discipline and training, your mind resonates, touched by the sublime designs of the Lord of Murder, and opens to new strategies and dreams of slaughter.
Show me the way

In the frenzy of last night's ritual, some of your sisters were overcome by Khaine's bloodlust and attacked you. Unable to resist to all of them, you barely managed to survive, albeit seriously wounded.
Grrnpfh!
Death and blood course through your veins, you can hear Khaine's voice whispering to you, telling you of his next victims, sharpening your will and senses.
I'm ready to do your bidding, o Lord of Murder.

The Witch Elves come at night, silent and deadly, but it is not your blood they seek. Snatched from your palace, you're brought shrieking at the Alter of Khaine and baptised in blood. You shall live with the brides of the Lord of Murder and become an Assassin.

Your [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] has been kidnapped! The Witch Elves sneaked in at night and took the infant from [From.GetHerHis] crib. Though many children do not survive in the church of Khaine, [From.GetFirstName] might be skilled and blessed enough to do so and grow into a deadly Assassin.
For the glory of Khaine
Tha big bad beasty goz down an' eatz dead the bad boy. Makes other bad boyz turn good and tha' why good Bosses have big beasties.
Rumpfh.
Your brutish captor has decided to feed you to his ravenous pet wyvern.
Aaargh!!
Dragon Eater
In Naggaroth, a Dragon egg is naught but a potential source of power. It can be consumed so that the devourer obtains a portion of its strength, or kept to gain a fearsome mount in the future.
This power shall be mine
On second thoughts, this is clearly a waste of a dragon.
Dragonrider

The black dragons of Naggarond are fearsome creatures, and with a decade to spare, money, and enough prestige, it will be possible to acquire a black dragon egg and raise it up to serve as your mount.
A Dragonrider I shall be
On seconds thoughts, maybe a cold one would suffice
The Egg Hatches

A year has passed, and your dragon egg has hatched. The newborn rears its wings and attempts a mighty roar, but instead just mewls like a newborn babe. In nine years your dragon should be fully grown and ready to battle by your side.
A way to go yet...
I no longer possess a black dragon egg
Dragon Rising
Nine years have passed and your dragon has finally reached maturity. Having bonded with you and been trained for battle, you now have a mount that will make your enemies flee before you in terror.
I hope they fail their leadership tests
I no longer possess a black dragon hatchling
A Powerful Inheritance
I have come into possession of a Black Dragon Egg. I could keep possession of it or sell it for a quick profit.
I better keep hold of something this powerful
Sell it
A Powerful Inheritance
I have come into possession of a Black Dragon Hatchling. I could keep possession of it or sell it for a quick profit.
I better keep hold of something this powerful
Sell it
Hydra Blade

The Hydra Blade was carved from a single fang of Akholrak, first and greatest of the War Hydras broken to Malekith's service, and like its many-headed namesake, its keen edge srikes repeatedly against its foes. Though Akholrak is dead now, torn asunder long ago by the talons of the great Caledorian Dragon Incalamir, its malice lives on within this gnarled and twisted sword. Only those of iron will can hope to dominate the Hydra Blade, for it is imbued with an echo of Aholrak's malice and is little inclined to suffer the commands of another. Most wielders discover the blade's wilfulness more than offset by its alacrity, but more than a few have perished needlessly in encounters where skill would have served them far better than speed.
Chillblade

When Malekith obliterated the northern citadel of Har Kaldra, he offered neither warning nor quarter. The iron-clad fortress was blasted to rime-scarred splinters with a single cataclysmic spell. Ever after, the freezing north wind has wailed with the agonised voices of those who perished that day, and its chill grasp can be held at bay by neither fur nor flame. It was from scattered shards of Har Kaldra that the Chillblade was forged. Its merest touch freezes not only the physical body but also the soul within, leaving the victim paralysed and easy prey for his attacks' next strike.
Black Dragon Egg

In Ulthuan, the egg of a Dragon is sacred, and harsh punishment awaits any who endanger or disturb a Dragon nest. In Naggaroth, a Dragon egg is naught but a potential source of power, and their nests nothing but cradles to nurture that power. So it is that for every Black Dragon Egg that develops into a hatchling, countless dozens more are taken and consumed, so that their devourers might take a portion of the egg's strength as their own.
Cloak of Twilight

Woven from the hair of innocents and dyed with the blood of sorcerers, the Cloak of Twilight is all but invisible to the mortal eye. The cloak has served many masters well across the long centuries. It was this garb that allowed Morathi to keep a close watch on the Phoenix Court of Bel Shanaar, even from Nagarythe. Centuries later, it had passed from the Hag Sorceress' hands and became the tool that allowed the master assassin, Venomblade, to stalk the blood-slicked streets of Tor Elyr as he visited his night of Screaming Death upon the folk of that great city. Ownership of the Cloak of Twilight guarantees an ambitious Dark Elf the success he craves, but is not without risk. However determined its wearer, there is always a more ruthless pretender, his mind set to steal the cloak's power for his own.
The Black Amulet

Carved from the tortured heartstone of a mountain drenched in Dark Magic, the Black Amulet is a lustrous polished stone of midnight hue. It is engraved with a single glowing rune, and into its ebony facets have been poured all the captured malice and spite that emanates from the chill lands of Naggaroth. To behold its darksome shape is to see despair made physical, it is to abandon even the merest memory of hope.
Ring of Hotek

Hotek was an outcast priest of Vaul. It was he who forged Malekith's rune-etched armour, and he also oversaw the creation of many of the Witch King's most terrible weapons. Renegade and turncoat though he was, Hotek was no fool. He knew that he lived only at Malekith's fickle pleasure, and so created for himself an armoury of defences - both magical and physical - with which he hoped to blunt the Witch King's wrath long enough to escape. Ultimately, Hotek did not perish at Malekith's hands, but was poisoned on Morathi's order. His armoury was broken up soon after, the scattered pieces changing hands with the ebb and flow of patronage and power. None of the artifacts have known as many masters as the Ring of Hotek, for this trinket of obsidian and black diamond is claimed to be the renegade priest's greatest work.
Banner of Nagarythe

During the sundering, many of Nagarythe's treasures were lost in battle or destroyed by natural disaster. Those that remained were greedily seized upon by nobles of both allegiances. Some fell into the hands of the Aesanar, who hid them away from Malekith's forces, but the most important were taken by the Dark Elves. The Banner of Nagarythe is the greatest of all such treasures, woven through with silver thread and inlaid with pearls and diamonds. For the Dark Elves, the Banner of Nagarythe is a physical reminder of the injustices heaped upon them by the Phoenix Throne. Moreover, it is the personal standard of the Witch King and proclaims his right to rule not only Naggaroth, but the ten kingdoms of Ulthuan as well. For their part, the Shadow Warriros of Nagarythe deem this banner too mired in corruption and betrayal to any longer have any wholesome purpose. They seek not its return, but its destruction.
The Gem of Spite

Many Dark Elves feel that a misfortune shared, if not exactly a misfortune havled, then at least one in which they can take a certain malignant (and possible posthumous) glee. Such was the goal behind the creation of the Gem of Spite. It was fashioned during a rare civil war in Ghrond, when sorceress fought sorceress in an attempt to claim a place at Morathi's right hand. The Gem of Spite still turns up from time to time, normally in the possession of one who has fallen from the Hag Sorceress' favour.
The Sacrificial Dagger

This dagger is a tiny splinter of the cruel weapon wielded by Hekarti, Goddess of Dark Magic. It was shivered from her blade during a failed attempt to sacrifice her sister, Atharti, to an older and darker power than she. The shard was flung far and came to rest in the caverns beneath Ghrond. Here, amongst the bleached bones and rubble, itwas discovered by Khaeleth the Sorceress. She claimed the dagger as her own and learned how to unlock its power to transmute the soul-essence of living creatures into a raw and hungry magic. So began Khaeleth's rise to the foremost seat of power within the Dark Convent of Ghrond, an elevation marked by blood sacrifice and the darkest of sorceries.
Tome of Furion

Dark Magic is destruction incarnate - even it most basic precepts are corrosive to mind, body and soul. Few tomes containing its secrets therefore exist, for mere paper and papyrus smoulder to naught within decades of being inked with such sigils. THe tome of Furion is a rare exception to this rule. Its pages are flayed Orc hide, but the book endures its burdens thanks only to the carefully layered enchantments Furion bound into its covers. The letters inscribed within writhe and shift like living creatures, and the pages are warm to the touch even in the dead of winter.
Seraphon

Seraphon is the terrifying black dragon that Malekith rides into battle. He was the first of his batch to hatch, and upon doing so devoured many of his unborn siblings. Malekith was impressed by the newborn's ruthlessness and took him as his mount.
Destroyer

Forged by the Witch King of Naggaroth himself, this blade is a symbol of the Dark Elves' determination to destroy the Asur and all their works. The Destroyer's merest touch can unmake enchantments or even drain knowledge from the minds of unwary wizards.
Armour of Midnight
Malekith's rune-armour is forged from the hardest meteoric iron and protects against any mortal weapon.
Supreme Spellshield
The Supreme Spellshield absorbs magic and then unleashes the energy back at the foe.
Circlet of Iron
The Circlet of Iron is said to be older than the race of Elves and is a potent source of magical power.
Heartrender and the Darksword

The Heartrender's blade is a wicked thing, laden with vile enchantments to seek an opponent's heart. The Darksword too is bewitched, but with spells of blinding and enfeeblement that sap a foe of his strength even if he survivies the blow.
Sulephet

The beloved mount of Morathi, the Dark Pegasus Sulephet is a coal-black, burning-eyed hell steed with enormous wings. Mist emerges from its nostrils, reminiscent of the poison gas that vents from chasms in the Northern Wastes. Sulephet greets the Hag Sorceress with eyes blazing with lust, hatred and a curious, twisted love. The beast whinnies with pleasure from the spells woven into Morathi's hands when the Dark Elf strokes its cheek.
Deathsword and the Cursed Blade
The Deathsword glistens with murder and the Cursed Blade moves with a life of its own.
Amulet of Dark Fire
This amulet wreathes its wearer in a mystical flame that burns magic instead of flesh.
Crimson Death
This huge halberd was carried by Dark Lord Khalak of Ghrond, the first captain of the Black Guard. Each captain since has prised it out of his predecessor's dead hands
The Armour of Grief
This enchanted armour was first worn by Arnaethron, one of the Witch King's first lieutenants. Those that strike the wearer find themselves sharing in the injury.

Nagarythian Ascendancy

The Druchii are proud and stubborn as their insular cousins, but they are also vicious raiders and slavers renown for their cruelty. Druchii society is built upon mistrust and backstabbing, the Dark Elves are slow to trust and ready to mercilessly enslave humans and other lesser races without the least concern for their well-being.
Witch Kingdom

The Witch King has created his realm upon fear and ruthlessness, asserting near-absolute power over all of his subjects. As long as he lives and holds on Naggaroth, he can freely revoke titles from any of his vassals and force absolute compliance over his subjects through his network of spies and assassins.
